isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Block the right countershaft against the wall of the case and place the mainshaft into position, meshing the gears with those of the left countershaft ( Figure 224).
Install the reverse gear washer, flat side to the rear ( Figure 225).
Seat the mainshaft rear bearing in the case bore ( Figure 226).

figure.caption: Figure 225. Seat Mainshaft Rear Bearing in Case Bore

step1.para: Install the six springs in the centering ring using a small amount of grease or equivalent in each of the centering ring bores to hold the springs in place. Place the centering ring on the shaft and slide into the rear bearing against the reverse gear washer ( Figure 227).

figure.caption: Figure 226. Place Centering Ring on Shaft and Slide into Rear Bearing

step1.para: Install the splined retainer washer on the shaft, cone surface toward the centering ring ( Figure 228).

figure.caption: Figure 227. Install Splined Retainer Washer on Shaft

step1.para: Place the snap ring on the shaft against the splined retainer washer ( Figure 229).

figure.caption: Figure 228. Place Snap Ring on Shaft

step1.para: Block against the front of the mainshaft and use a sleeve driver to move the centering ring, retainer washer and snap ring forward until the snap ring seats in the groove in the mainshaft ( Figure 230).

figure.caption: Figure 229. Move Centering Ring, Retainer Washer and Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the rear bearing retainers. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m). Secure the bolts with the locking tangs ( Figure 231).

figure.caption: Figure 230. Install and Tighten Rear Bearing Retainers
